intro.description: The following steps show how to exchange process variable information between CSS Tools.

item.title: Run the previous tutorial - the Data Browser exercise
item.description: If you have already plotted a sine wave, just skip the following steps.

item.title: Open the dedicated perspective
item.description: Menu Window -> Open Perspective -> Other… and select Data Browser.

item.title: Open a new plot
item.description: From the Tool bar, click on icon "new Data Browser plot" in CSS toolbar or use the menu CSS -> Trends -> Data Browser.

item.title: Add a PV
item.description: Right-click on the plot contextual menu, select the option "Add PV". Enter Name “sim://sine”

item.title: Data Browser Perspective -> Properties View
item.description: Click on the plot area and the Properties view will display information about the PV name, trace color, scan period...

item.title: Process Variable contextual menu
item.description: If you have lost the focus, click on the plot and from the Data Browser Perspective -> Properties View, right-click on “sim://sine”, select the contextual menu "Process Variable", use the little arrow on the right and select CSS Probe Tool. The Probe tool is started and should display the current value of the plotted sine PV together with time stamp and status
